Leonard, Emilius, and Gari 

To Leonard, Garlic (the dwarf) responds with a sweeping look at the dead bodies scattered across the floor. “An optimistic man would say sleeping… but I think we both know better”. Then, you all turn towards the sealed door. Gari, Emilius, and Leonard, working together (Religion check) you’re able to confirm that the four symbols on the side represent major demigods {The Heretic (Fire & Winter), Was-tet (Water & Spring), Vrush (Wind & Fall), & Korn (Earth & Summer)} and all pay homage to the god symbolized at the top; Kringle (elements and weather).


Emilius, your knowledge of the Arcane tells you that, somehow, the four demigod symbols are magically linked to the sealed door. Your investigation of the door itself reveals that the four symbols are actually little trap doors. Behind all four are empty little alcoves. The topmost symbol, Kringle’s, is not a door and is just a regular tile.


Geremy & Lao 

Garlic cautiously lifts himself out of the cupboard, both in fear of the tentacle beast and of Geremy and your dagger. After taking the scene in around him he exclaims, “You guys drove the beasts away! This is fantastic! As far as I know, you’re the first in four guilds to do it… He looks sadly at the dead bodies in the room around him before continuing… ”so congrats on that. Uhh… what’s the plan now? If I may, I recommend getting the hell out of here. Not to be rude, Lao, Garlic at your service! I’m just eager to get out of here. Also, who killed the beasts? What did you do with the pelts? Can make a nice profit if properly skinned.”


Grum 

Unfortunately, the only use you can think of the tentacle is as a trophy. Not much else can be done with it. Looking around the courtyard, you see several other entrances into the palace. All are dark and foreboding. The head of the Elf statue had a long fall, and cracked in two on impact with the ground. It’s actually rather comical. 2/3s of the head sits straight up, as if standing at attention. The other 1/3 leans against the other part, with the top of 1/3 piece touching the 2/3 piece, and the bottom of the 1/3 piece angled away. (Like this |\ ). As you go to look away to something not quite so ‘idol-ish’, you swear on your clan mother’s life that the eyes of the statue glance in your direction before returning to their forward position.

Surprised by Geremys ability to procure his own kind from a cupboard, I take a moment to investigate the entrance room and peak into the flooded room.


Investigation: 1d20 + 2 ⇒ (10)+2 -> 12


After I take a moment to meditate in the courtyard and come down from the euphoria of battle.


I'm down HP from a tree fall, I meditate and use my healers kit to mend my wounds. Let me know if I didn't roll correctly 

Medicine: 1d20 + 4 ⇒ (7) + 4 -> 11 1d10 ⇒ 9

Iago Sorry, medicine can’t be used to heal wounds quite like that. It’s used to stop poison, prevent someone from bleeding out, due autopsies, or stuff like that. Healing can be done with a long rest or magical means (like if you knew a paladin…). The flooded room is built about 2 feel below the entrance room, there are some stone steps leading down. It smells heavily of stagnant water and rotting wood. Thick, wooden benches and tables show that this room used to be a dining hall. A trail of purple-black blood leads up the side of the cabinet that the beast used as a perch. The cabinet is located below a large hole in the ceiling. Around the hole are claw marks. You hear a small plop as you examine the room. Blood is dripping from the ceiling rafters, near the hole, onto one of the tables. If you strain your ears, you can all hear the sound of whimpering.


Leonard and Emilius


Emilius places the ‘elements’ in their respective cubbies and holds her breath. A moment later, you both hear a clicking noise behind the wall. The topmost symbol’s tile (Kringle’s) pops open. The door, however, remains closed. Inside the newly opened space, you see three things (after standing on your tippy toes). The first is an inscription that reads “Power is balanced between Gods, Kings, and the People. To enter this vault, you’ll need the approval of all three”. The second is a key with the symbol of the God Kringle at the base. The third thing you see are three keyholes.


Geremy


Garlic shrugs and starts rummaging before you even finish speaking. “Don’t worry about it Geremy. I’ve been loot- err.. I mean scavanging from them for over a month. If they’re offended by it, they haven’t spoken up about it yet.” Unfortunately, the pickings are slim. These adventures were clearly the sort that were on the hunt for treasure, not the sort that had found it. Still, you scrape together 10 gold… and a jar with glowing red liquid inside! It smells strongly, but not altogether unpleasantly, of cherries.


Grum,


After collecting the partial head, you go to the well and drop a stone. You can’t see it land, but the sound it makes is neither a splash of hitting water, nor is it a crash of hitting stone. It sounds as if it hits something soft; Such as cloth, mud, or grass. Pondering that, you wonder away towards the under palace entrences but a voice inturrupts your thoughts. “Excuse me, my good… orc. Would you be so kind as to put me back. .” The voice is coming from your pack! It sounds both regal, and a touch entitled. Unslinging your pack, you see an eye peering at your from an opening. The voice continues.“I don’t mean to be rude, but I have a splitting headahce and I dare say that a king deserves a touch more respect than being slung in a pack and forgotten!”

I grab the key with Kringle's symbol on it. "Leonard, Gari, come read this inscription! We've got the 'Gods' key, what do you think about the Kings and the People references?" I try to take a closer look at the key and the keyholes, seeing if I can glean anymore clues. 


Perception: 1d20 + 5 ⇒ (2) + 5 -> 7 Welp.

I walk over to the threshold between the entrance and the flooded room. 

"Gari! I'm glad you're doing well. Let's see..."I take a quick head count. Not counting Geremy's new friend (or illusion. It's too early to get attached), Everyone seems to be here, except...


"The new fellow, Grum. He's still out there. The beast ran away, so we should be safe." I grin widely and look around the group. "Does anyone have a medicine kit? Our friend Iago could use some attention."

And we're back!


All:

To summarize and bring everyone back to the same page a quick recap: Displacer Beasts have been driven off (for now....) and the vault you're trying to get into has three keyholes:

  • God Key: Emilius has it from solving the door riddle.
  • King Key: M.I.A.
  • People Key: M.I.A.


Emilius:

Unfortunately, not much more information can be gleamed from the keyholes other than the obvious; there are three key holes, and you have one key. Looks like you need two more keys.


Leonard:

Just like Emilius, you fail to find any additional information from the keyholes.

Garlic is caught off guard by your booming voice. He jumps in shock and replies "I don't know! I haven't heard of any keys! My group did a quick sweep of the palace and didn't find nothing of the sort!"

It took me a second to understand your second post. Smart ass. Ha.


Ezra: "To early to get attached." I lol'd. You know that Leonard has some minor healing abilities.


Gari: Beyond a reasonable doubt, you confirm it is indeed a key. You also spot Ezra wondering around checking in and asking for a healer.


Grum:

The well isn't too deep. With the aid of some natural light, your dark vision can extend farther than usual. You can barely see it, but just shy of 100 feet down you spot something glimmering. Perhaps a little piece of metal.

The head, voice muffled from being in your pack, responds with "I cannot, my place is here. Please just be a good fellow and set my down where you found me."


Geremy:

Forgot to say, you can roll an arcana or intelligence check to find out what the liquid is.

The key isn't remarkable in any outlandish way. It's ornate, but un-noteworthy other than that.


Lao:

It doesn't take much imagination to see this would have made a splendid palace in the past. The fading paintings on the wall would have been vibrant, the shattered statue in the courtyard would have been near life-like, the gardens would have been lush, and the furniture masterfully crafted. It's really a shame what a state it is in now.

First to Garlic: Very well dwarf. Let me know if you require further assistance.


I stand up once more and address Ezra: I will take care of our injured friend. I march over to Iago and look over his wounds before moving yet closer. Fear not. As father Branca once told me at the monastery, "I do not want to hurt you, i just want to touch you." My soothing hands will heal you until you are capped out or i run out of the 5 charges of hitpoints i can heal per day, whichever comes first.


Once that is done, I will go into the courtyard as well. Companions, Emilius has been most successful in unraveling the mysteries behind the magic door so far. It is probably for the best to follow her lead for the time being.

I nod at Leonard and take a few steps back to give him room as he heads over to Iago. I turn and smile at Lao as he enters the room.


"Lao! Emlius and Leonard have said it best. We're looking for keys now. Grum and Emilius seem to have the courtyard covered. Would you mind helping me search the room over here?"


I look over to the flooded room. There are some areas that would be difficult for me to reach on my own, especially with an embryo in my pack. I untie a torch from my belt and shake it a couple times, muttering the appropriate words under my breath to create flame. It's difficult to remember who could see in the darkness and who couldn't, so it was safer to be polite.


[ooc: used prestidigitation]

[ooc: You're a human, right Lao?]

Leonard: hahahaha oh no

Ezra: yup, human


"Sure, let's take a look" I reply to Ezra. I stroll over to the flooded room and place my pack, boots, and outerwear into a pile onto the dry floor of the courtyard, before stepping down the stairs and wading into the standing water, a slightly perturbed look spreading on my face as it probably smells super great. As I move forward, I'm splitting my time between looking around, especially for the sparkle of metal in Ezra's torch, and frequently glancing upward at the hole that we can see the beasts escaped up into.



Perception: 1d20+4 ⇒ (8)+4 -> 12

[ooc] HEY! I finally made it [/ooc]

Hearing Iago ask for a healer draws me out of Displacer Beast Ballad that I was crafting in my head. I follow Leo over to Iago and perform cure wounds on him, humming to myself the tune to which the ballad might work best with. [b]"...hmmm, maybe 3/4 time........or 1/3. Or, 3/5 to encapsulate the beasts elusive nature? ...hmmm"[/b]


Cure Wounds healing amount: 1d8+2 ⇒ (5)+2 -> 7

HEY! I finally made it

Hearing Iago ask for a healer draws me out of Displacer Beast Ballad that I was crafting in my head. I follow Leo over to Iago and perform cure wounds on him, humming to myself the tune to which the ballad might work best with. "...hmmm, maybe 3/4 time........or 1/3. Or, 3/5 to encapsulate the beasts elusive nature? ...hmmm"

Cure Wounds healing amount: 1d8+2 ⇒ (5)+2 -> 7

Much better

Emilius, Leonard, & Grum:

Emilius and Leonard, you two stroll outside and spot Grum , who introduces you to 2/3’s of a stone head in a pack, before placing the pack and head on the ground. Grum, finding a sturdy tree to tie his rope to, busies himself with knot making (if this was 3e, you’d have to make a rope check… lol). After giving the rope a test yank and finding it secure, he positions himself to go down into the well itself (Grum, unsure if you were ready to dive in).


Meanwhile… Emilius & Leonard, as Grum busies himself with his spelunking, the stone head speaks to you (after waiting from Grum to be fully focused on his task). “Ohh thank Kringle and his infinite wisdom, civilized beings! …well, we’ll call you one and a half civilized beings anyways. Don’t listen to that brutish, bone-munching barbarian! I am a King. King Ebony Leaf to be precise!  To think that I would be so disrespected in death as to be handled by… an orc. Ugh! Anyways... What can I do for you fine people?”


Ezra & Lao:

The flooded room’s floor is about 2 feet below the entrance room, there are some stone steps leading down. It smells heavily of stagnant water and rotting wood. Thick, wooden benches and tables show that this room used to be a dining hall. A trail of purple-black blood leads up the side of the cabinet that the beast used as a perch. The cabinet is located below a large hole in the ceiling. Around the hole are claw marks. You hear a small plop as you examine the room. Blood is dripping from between ceiling rafters, near the hole, onto one of the tables. If you strain your ears, you can hear the sound of whimpering.


 At the opposite end of the room you’re in, you see a doorway with steps leading deeper down. If you had to guess, you would say it’s a cellar, though it’s completely flooded. The back right corner of the room (from where you entered) is partially collapsed, but you spot the remnants of a door frame. It’s difficult to say, but that door could have led to the courtyard, a kitchen, or a hallway deeper into the palace?


Gari:

Your post is all character to character interaction, so I have nothing of value to add… but I’m excited to hear your ballad… I love ballads.

"Have you spotted the hole in the ceiling yet, Captain?" I walk so that I'm right underneath the hole. "I thought it'd be easier for you to get up and look for another key, or possibly other treasures." I pause for a moment, taking a deep breath as I look around. Table, seats...elves used to eat here. I look at Lao, and suddenly realize that there might be another Displacer Beast on the upper floor. "Though if you prefer, I can go first if you can give me a boost".

I lean down and smile at the stone head (ignoring his racist remarks about non-elves).

"Highest praises King Ebony Leaf! I am the druid Emilius Hippopomus and my companion is Leonard of Roth. We seek two keys, one representing Kings and the other representing the People. Do you know where such keys may be? Or do you have information on where we might find them?"

I nod.

"Yes, good point. Good luck, then. Stay warm." I keep my eyes and torchlight on Lao as he dives into the water, then stand guard diligently...


for a minute or two. If Lao hasn't returned, I place the torch in a cup, or crack in the table, so that it's standing upright. I wave my hand at the torch and as it brightens (doubling bright and dim light radius. Should be nice and lit in here now.) I clamber up the cabinet and get as close to the hole as I can without moving in. Did the whimpering belong to the beast, or something else?



athletics: 1d20+1 ⇒ (19)+1 -> 20
 Trying to get close enough to hear the whimpering better


investigation: 1d20+3 ⇒ (15)+3 -> 18
 trying to discern the situation upstairs by hearing...

Emilius & Leonard: 

Speaking to Emilius "Finally somebody with class and taste." Then to both of you, "I knew where the Kings key was, unfortunately some vandals took it. You see, I was created to keep it safe and hidden... inside my body. The miscreants shattered me apart, took the key, and promptly got themselves killed by some displacer beasts. Last I saw of the key, it was on a chain around the neck of a man who was being chopped up by those vile cats... 


As for the People's Key... Well they were with the people before the incident." The eye that still remains on his shattered face looks towards the well.


To Leonard, he says "I appreciate the gesture... Human, but I don't believe you have the necessary skills. Perhaps when you return to town you'll be able to hire an elf of talent."


Lao:

At first, the submerged area is exactly what you'd expect; a wine cellar full with other dry food stores that have long been flooded and soaked to ruin. Looking further however, you see that the wall that used to Mark the boundary of the room had long ago collapsed away and a massive underwater Cavern is in its place. Given that it's dark and you're underwater, you can't see any details past a couple of feet ahead of you. If you're confident in your ability to hold your breath you can go explore that under water cavern, it looks like it remains underneath the palace.


Ezra:

Nice rolls.


You manage to clamber close enough to get a good listen in. You're fairly confident you hear the cat struggling to breathe, it doesn't sound long for this world. You also hear multiple whimpers and cries of similar species... But much smaller. They sound... Sad.

Seeing the size of the space before me, I return to the flooded room long enough to relay my initial findings to Ezra before diving back down again.


Looks like I drown, so that's unfortunate.

Oh no you didn't elf king!


I am getting visibly frustrated with the statue's condescension. King Ebony Leaf, were it in my power to get you an elvish stone mason, I would. Unfortunately, such folk are in short supply. Your elvish kingdom, much like your current physical form, lies shattered and largely forgotten. And what's more, your kind nowadays are no longer renowned for their skills with stone. However... (I look at him now with a demented grin) there are quite a few skilled dwarvish hands that would be more than able to put you back together...


To Emilius: It appears that our orc friend is on his way to reclaiming the people's key. Garlic said that the bodies of his former companions did not contain the key. We may have to hunt down and finish of the pair of displacer beasts. Even if we do not get the key, the world will at least be free of those abominations.

I cock my head to the side while I listen to the sounds above.


"They're sad." I say to Lao before he goes back down, but he's gone before I can say anything else. It'll be easier to search the room if the beast is dead, and there isn't anything I can do anyway. I don't have that kind of power. I listen for a bit longer, then bring my attention back to Lao. He didn't seem as prepared for his second dive as he was for his first...


but everything seems fine. I shouldn't doubt Lao like that.

Lao:

You emerge from the water take a deep breathe and triumphantly dive back in! ...before misjudging the depth of the pool, hitting the bottom after only a few feet, gasping in pain, realizing you're underwater and thus taken a lungful of water, and finally pulling yourself back out of the water 6 seconds later coughing and gagging. Wowza, a 2 and a 4. Who programmed this site's dice roller?!


Grum:

As you slowly lower yourself, a picture of the well reveals itself to you, fading in from the blackness. The well leads down into a large, water-filled cavern. The glimmer that caught your eye is resting on a small island. Then you climb lower, and more detail is revealed. The 'island' is actually a mass of debris floating in the water. You lower some more. The mass of floating debris is actually a large mass of cloth. You lower again. The cloth is clothes, and the clothes are warn be skeletons and rotting corpses. Brutal cut marks and wounds cover the corpses. (Investigation to find out more). The 'bobble' is a key with three simple stick figures on it. The key is on a rusty key chain hooked to a belt of one of the corpses.


Leonard, Emilius, and Gari:

The Elven King looks aghast at Leonard. "A Dwarven mason is the best you can do? Ugh. Very well. At least it's not Human... or worse, Orcish. Do by quick about it. Best of luck on those Displacer Beast. I have to admit, you fought well against them" He hastily adds "you know, for a group of inferiors" As he finishes, the half head of the the statue of the Elven King (damn, that's a mouthful) looks at Gari as he joins Emilius & Leonard. "Ohh for Kringle's sake, the degenerates are multiplying! I suppose you want me to perform a little dance for you. Or maybe play a song? Unfortunately, I only play Rock and Roll." With that, the stone head springs into life and tries to roll away. You'll need to roll both a Dex and Str save to try and stop him from rolling away, if you want to.


Ezra & Geremy:

Ezra, you strain your ears, but fail to hear anything over the gags & coughs of Lao. Maybe you should doubt him like that? As you return your focus to the hole in the ceiling, Geremy casts an illusion of himself climbing into the hole. A flurry of movement follows as you see the tiniest little Displacer Beast leap across the gap, going for the illusion Geremy's face. It flies right through and is in free fall for all of one second before a full size purple tentacle whips out and catches the kitten, pulling back into the 'den'. The tentacle, despite only being visible for a second, is clearly badly damaged and slick with blood.

I pay little attention to how people die, just that they are dead and I am not. rip Investigate

Looking around I am disappointed, just a stinky key no gold or weapons... I start to head up toward the surface before....

"Ha. Stupid... Keyz open doors, doors hide lootz.... But wat door?"


I reach down drawing a dagger from my own belt, I cut the belt and grab the key. Unless something pops out of the water and tries to drag me in I climb back to the surface, disappointed.

My patience is at an end with the statue: KEEP ROLLING YOU FORGOTTEN ELF! IF YOU LEAVE, WE WILL REPLACE YOU WITH A STRONGER SYMBOL! Also, rock and roll doesn't exist in D&D (ps: keep the volume low for this https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=I0gXomy5Dxw )


From there, I'll check up on Ezra and Geremy and see what all the commotion is about.

I think for a moment as Lao's breathing evens out.

"I think it would be safest to wait for the creature to die on its own." I say, getting myself into the best position to climb up into the hole. "Unfortunately, I think its mate is still alive and may return if we don't hurry."


I wave my hand over my amulet and mutter the appropriate words. A translucent grey sheen envelopes my body from my neck to my hands to my feet. Then I try to climb up into the den before the mini beast attacks again.


mage armor, last slot for the day.


edit: oof.

All:

I think Lao is subtly fucking with us by having the dice roller max out at ten for d20s. Also, sorry for the delayed post. I know you were all at the edge of your seats.


Lao:

By the end of your short break, you feel significantly better. The shallows are relaxing, until Leonard barges into the room dramatically (as is his style), destroying the calm. You stare at him, notice he's staring at the den, you stare at the den in response, and see Ezra scramble up into the den too.


Emilius:

The stone head is past you before you have time to react. If anything you should be grateful your reaction time was insufficient. It looks like the great stone would have rolled through you without slowdown had you tried to stand in the way. As the stone rolls away, you hear the elf king taunt "you can't stop me, I'm on a roll! right as he disappears from view into an unexplored part of the palace.


Grum:

The people in the well died of natural causes in their old age and lived happy lives before that (based off your investigation). With the key in your possession, you safely climb back out of the well. Nothing reacted in the water. As you pull yourself out, you catch the glimpse of the Elf King's statue's head rolling away.


Leonard:

The elf king moves past you, ignoring your words. Frustrated you return inside to find Lao soaking in a pool and Ezra performing the most pathetic pull up you've ever seen an adult perform. (See below)


Ezra:

You cast your spell and feel the familiar vibration of protective arcane energy around you. Then you step onto the cabinet leading into the the den and awkwardly hoist yourself up. It isn't elegant, but the move gets the job done... barely. The den is surprisingly neat for wild beasts.


In one corner, is a fresh adventurer corpse with small chunks of his body missing. The corner opposite of that is an open space. Another corner looks like the "restroom", with feces dominating both the space, and the air. The corner opposite of that houses a litter of cute little displacer kittens eyeing you curiously. Curled around them in a protective stance is the full grown cat. The wounds are vicious, but it hasn't succumb to them yet. It contents itself to eye you as you pull yourself into it's den.

Indeed, I enter with all the might a paladin of my stature should. I look for a second at Lao Now is not the time to be splashing abou- I then notice Ezra climbing up. And where are you going to? Please do not head up there alone! At this point, I move to follow my bold friend.

Turning toward Emilius - "Nah. Lordy was mor' liken to be left alone... that be strange magi... you lookin' for a key?"

I turn out my hand and revel the key I got from the well.

"Didn' dink much of it when I've found it...."


"Were' haven' we be lookin' yet Emilius for dat loot"

Emilius & Grum:

Haaa, ass face. Because he has a track in his head. Cleverrrr. Off in the distance, barely at the range of your hearing, you hear the king respond to your 'ass head' comment with a "Hey, fuck youuuuu" with the last word fading out of notice. Despite the uncharacteristic response from the king, you're the winners as Grum shows off the People Key!



Lao, Leonard, & Ezra:

Are monks made of lead? Also, Ezra, nice perception, first non-shit roll of the new site! ...speaking of which:


Ezra and Leonard scramble into the den as Lao catches his breath... again. The injured Displacer Beast stares at you with blood shot eyes but doesn't attack you. As you move about the room searching, the tentacle will start to raise if you get close to the cat or her kittens, but if you move away it rests back on the ground. Even that small movement strains the creature. The kittens alternate between crying for their parent and staring at you curiously.


Ezra is the first to spot the key. As he moves about, a beam of light comes in through a crack in the ceiling and reflects off a piece of metal... poking out of cat feces in the corner. On it, you see a crown carved on the base. You've found the King Key!

"There's another, Leonard. Be careful." I say, as I not-too-carefully pluck the key. As my hand grabs hold on the key, I linger next to the pile of feces for a moment to make sure I'm not missing any other valuables.


I shake the key lightly, muttering the appropriate word under my breath as the key and my hand are magically cleaned of any excrement. Key in my possession, I turn back to the displacer beast and its kittens. "Are you going to kill it?" I ask.

I give a tusky and toothy grin. "Huh... So I did..." 

I look around the courtyard, "King key? Don't know were' dat be"


I walk to the front room, yelling loudly 

"Oi' you lot find a... Umm... King Key?"


Looking down at the soggy monk... "Find anythang' swimmin'?"

All

Breaking my own rules by responding ASAP to give you more options: The low hum coming from the door dies as the last key is inserted and turned. As if it were a picture painted directly onto glass, the image of the door cracks, then shatters. As the jagged pieces hit the floor, they turn into a silver vapor before dispelling into nothingness.


The room beyond is large and fabulously ornate. Lavish curtains, dyed in the most expensive colors, hang from the walls. The molding and crowns of the room are covered in intricate stone so meticulously carved and painted that they look life like without careful inspection. The floor and ceiling are perfect white marble, tiled so masterfully that it appears to have been poured (rather than placed) into the room. Thick lock boxes and chests of perfectly preserved oak and shiny steel dominate floor-space. Most importantly of all, however, is that the room has been clearly ransacked.


The lock boxes and chests doors are opens and empty. Not even the typical layer of dust lines the bases. The room looks as if it had been perfectly preserved since it was sealed. Compounding this, is what appears to be a freshly dead elvish body right in the back wall of the room. The body faces the doorway, propped up by an Orcish spear that runs straight through his chest and into the wall. The spear point is buried at least few inches into the wall. A powerful throw indeed...


Emilius, Leonard, and Grum recognize the face. They recently had a conversation with it.. well at least 2/3 of a stone recreation of it.

wah-waaah


I let out a snotty laugh. "Lootin'. Ha! Just our luck." I walk inside the room and seeing the "Fresh" softie lord. "One... Two... Umm... I bein' no expart but shouldn't he be... older or rotten?"


I inspect the spear for any tribal markings or designs that would tell me an owner.

All

Sorry for the late post. I have failed you.


Grum

The clan markings are prominently displayed up and down the shaft of the weapon, carefully carved in and reinforced with ash and creating a tasteful (given your background) black on brown clash. The clan markings seem to be a predecessor of the largest clan on the island, the Blood Banded. The symbols have obviously evolved from the time this spear was constructed but the origin is pretty clear.


Gari & Ezra

It sounded like you guys wanted to inspect the room closer. The room has obviously been looted, but in the most bizarre way. Most time, when rooms are looted, chests are smashed open and furniture tossed around as the looters scavenge for everything valuable. This situation is different the room is immaculate, except for the fact that it has been robbed blind. You get the creeping impression that the robbers tiptoed about the room as they took everything of value. They weren't too careful though... In the back of the lock box, obscured by shadows, you two find a small sack. Your initially annoyed when you open it and find 20 silver pieces, but then you catch the gleam. Not silver. No, platinum. 20 Platinum pieces (worth 200 gold pieces). This is probably the first time you've seen the precious metal in person.


Leonard

The room and everything in it lacks any indication of an evil aura. It's neutral all around.


Emilius & Geremy

It sounded like you guys wanted to inspect the body closer. You both wonder over to the body. The clothes are incredibly finely made, with gold threads weaved throughout. If it didn't have a massive hole right in the middle, with a massive blood stain right down the middle, you could have probably sold it for a handsome profit. The blood stain necessitates further inspection, after having drawn closer you see its... fresh. Really fresh. Blood is still pulsating out of it. Then, you hear a single, short, sharp intake of breath. The body twitches with the effort. The elf king king is still alive, but it's obvious he wont hang around much longer.

I rush to the king's side once I realize he's still alive, kneeling beside him."He's alive! Can anyone heal him?! King Ebony Leaf, what happened here?"
